content= The specific species of mangrove tree which attracts these fireflies is the berembang (sonneratia caseolaris). Firefly watching at Sungai Kerian is increasingly drawing visitors, and the firefly is an icon of Nibong Tebal. The fireflies emit light at the lower abdomen not only to attract mates but also to scare away predators. Their abdomens are filled with a chemical called lucibufagens. Sunset cruises and tours are offered.
Catching "Udang Galah" (called "jumbo shrimp" in English, but really more like langoustines)
is an annual event. It was held at Tapak Pesta, next to Sungai Nibong bus station in November, 2013. It included snacks, entertainment, and sales of local products.

Nice sea food avalable in nibong tebal and some high quality restaurant in Taman pekaka ,near USM engineering campus
such as ex-sara (nice Iranian kebab and rice ) , M Box and Al-Rahman nasi kandar (good tandoori chiken ). Besides this, Radha's Corner offers Indian food (only during lunch time) that some say is the best in town.
In Pekaka you can find some good drinks such as traditional tea and laichi spesial drink.

value: content=Lot 414, Mukim 6, Jalan Paya Kemian Sempayi.
